YARROW: Be welcomed in the <color=orange>Hourglass Observatory,</color> Clary!

1
YARROW: If you are visiting today to learn about the cause of the sand transfer between the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins,</color> we invite you to look through the observation deck above.
3 2
YARROW: As the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> orbit around each other, they become aligned along a straight line with the sun at regular intervals, casting a sunless day on the twin farther from the sun.
4
3
YARROW: The twin farther from the sun feels not only gravity from the other twin - but also gravity from the sun, pulling it in the same direction.
5
4
YARROW: It is this combined gravitational force that causes sand to be pulled towards the other twin at the alignment point, creating the striking funnel of sand between the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins.</color>
6
5
YARROW: This force wanes as the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> orbit out of alignment. It is only when they complete a full revolution around their barycenter that the flow of sand begins once more, flowing back towards the other twin.
7
6
CLARY: You have my deepest gratitude for your thorough explanation, Yarrow. I feel much more at ease now, knowing when and why the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins'</color> sand transfer occurs!

YARROW: Orbiting around each other like moons, the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> feel a constant pull of gravity from each other. However, this force alone is not strong enough to cause sand transfer.
